paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician, A Psalm and Song of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician, A Psalm and Song of David.

paragraphs.content: Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Sion: and unto thee shall the vow be performed.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Sion: and unto thee shall the vow be performed.

paragraphs.content: O thou that hearest prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O thou that hearest prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.

paragraphs.content: Iniquities prevail against me: as for our transgressions, thou shalt purge them away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Iniquities prevail against me: as for our transgressions, thou shalt purge them away.

paragraphs.content: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach unto thee, that he may dwell in thy courts: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, even of thy holy temple.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Blessed is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach unto thee, that he may dwell in thy courts: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house, even of thy holy temple.

paragraphs.content: By terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our salvation; who art the confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of them that are afar off upon the sea:
paragraphs.contentHtml: By terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our salvation; who art the confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of them that are afar off upon the sea:

paragraphs.content: Which by his strength setteth fast the mountains; being girded with power:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which by his strength setteth fast the mountains; being girded with power:

paragraphs.content: Which stilleth the noise of the seas, the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the people.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which stilleth the noise of the seas, the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the people.

paragraphs.content: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens: thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy tokens: thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.

paragraphs.content: Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it: thou greatly enrichest it with the river of God, which is full of water: thou preparest them corn, when thou hast so provided for it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it: thou greatly enrichest it with the river of God, which is full of water: thou preparest them corn, when thou hast so provided for it.

paragraphs.content: Thou waterest the ridges thereof abundantly: thou settlest the furrows thereof: thou makest it soft with showers: thou blessest the springing thereof.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou waterest the ridges thereof abundantly: thou settlest the furrows thereof: thou makest it soft with showers: thou blessest the springing thereof.

paragraphs.content: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness; and thy paths drop fatness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou crownest the year with thy goodness; and thy paths drop fatness.

paragraphs.content: They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness: and the little hills rejoice on every side.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They drop upon the pastures of the wilderness: and the little hills rejoice on every side.

paragraphs.content: The pastures are clothed with flocks; the valleys also are covered over with corn; they shout for joy, they also sing.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The pastures are clothed with flocks; the valleys also are covered over with corn; they shout for joy, they also sing.
